data.name: Bellossom
data.flavorText: Plentiful in the tropics. When it dances, its petals rub together and make a pleasant ringing sound.

attacks.name: Flower Spin
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 80 damage for each heads. Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Tangrowth
data.flavorText: Tangrowth has two arms that it can extend as it pleases. Recent research has shown that these arms are, in fact, bundles of vines.

attacks.name: Suctioning Vines
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Carnivine
data.flavorText: It binds itself to trees in marshes. It attracts prey with its sweet-smelling drool and gulps them down.

attacks.name: Festering Saliva
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned and Poisoned.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon can't retreat.

data.name: Leafeon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Slashing Strike
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Slashing Strike.

data.name: Leafeon VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Ivy Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Leaf Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Grubbin
data.flavorText: It uses its big jaws to dig nests into the forest floor, and it loves to feed on sweet tree sap.

attacks.name: Energize
attacks.text: Attach a Lightning Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Entei
data.flavorText: It is said that when it roars, a volcano erupts somewhere around the globe.

abilities.name: Explosive Heat Dash
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Fire Energy attached, it has no Retreat Cost.

data.name: Wailord
data.flavorText: It can sometimes knock out opponents with the shock created by breaching and crashing its big body onto the water.

attacks.name: Bubble Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Corphish
data.flavorText: No matter how dirty the water in the river, it will adapt and thrive. It has a strong will to survive.

data.name: Kyogre V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dual Splash
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Aqua Typhoon
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Aqua Typhoon.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: By joining its tail with that of another Luxio, this Pokémon can receive some of the other Luxio's electricity and power up its own electric blasts.

attacks.name: Shorting Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 90 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon that has a Pokémon Tool attached. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Eelektrik
data.flavorText: These Pokémon have a big appetite. When they spot their prey, they attack it and paralyze it with electricity.

abilities.name: Ad Hoc Shock
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand to evolve 1 of your Pokémon during your turn, you may flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Tangela
data.flavorText: Hidden beneath a tangle of vines that grows nonstop even if the vines are torn off, this Pokémon's true appearance remains a mystery.

data.name: Scyther
data.flavorText: As Scyther fights more and more battles, its scythes become sharper and sharper. With a single slice, Scyther can fell a massive tree.

attacks.name: Mach Cut
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Kricketot
data.flavorText: When its antennae hit each other, it sounds like the music of a xylophone.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Zarude
data.flavorText: Within dense forests, this Pokémon lives in a pack with others of its kind. It's incredibly aggressive, and the other Pokémon of the forest fear it.

attacks.name: Drag Off
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon. This attack does 20 damage to the new Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Triple Whip
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 70 damage for each heads.

data.name: Calyrex
data.flavorText: Calyrex is a merciful Pokémon, capable of providing healing and blessings. It reigned over the Galar region in times of yore.

attacks.name: King's Instructions
attacks.text: You may search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Bloomshine
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.

data.name: Charizard V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Incinerate
attacks.text: Before doing damage, discard all Pokémon Tools from your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Charizard VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Explosive Fire
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

attacks.name: Star Blaze
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Volcanion
data.flavorText: It expels its internal steam from the arms on its back. It has enough power to blow away a mountain.

attacks.name: Hydro Burn
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Salazzle
data.flavorText: Only female Salazzle exist. They emit a gas laden with pheromones to captivate male Salandit.

attacks.name: Tail Trickery
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Super Singe
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Burned.

data.name: Luxio
data.flavorText: Strong electricity courses through the tips of its sharp claws. A light scratch causes fainting in foes.

attacks.name: Jumping Kick
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: Luxray's ability to see through objects comes in handy when it's scouting for danger.

attacks.name: Electrostep
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.) Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Scar Strikes
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon already has any damage counters on it, this attack does 100 more damage.

data.name: Rotom V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Instant Charge
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may draw 3 cards. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Scrap Short
attacks.text: Put any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile in the Lost Zone. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you put in the Lost Zone in this way.

data.name: Rotom VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Conversion Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may use this Ability. Discard any number of cards from your hand. Then, draw that many cards. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Scrap Pulse
attacks.text: Put any number of Pokémon Tool cards from your discard pile in the Lost Zone. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you put in the Lost Zone in this way.

data.name: Oddish
data.flavorText: If exposed to moonlight, it starts to move. It roams far and wide at night to scatter its seeds.

attacks.name: Leaf Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Sunkern
data.flavorText: It lives by drinking only dewdrops from under the leaves of plants. It is said that it eats nothing else.

data.name: Cherubi
data.flavorText: The deeper a Cherubi's red, the more nutrients it has stockpiled in its body. And the sweeter and tastier its small ball!

data.name: Simisear V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Bursting Power
attacks.text: You may attach up to 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to your Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Flare Juggling
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Larvesta
data.flavorText: The people of ancient times believed that Larvesta fell from the sun.

data.name: Volcarona
data.flavorText: Volcarona scatters burning scales. Some say it does this to start fires. Others say it's trying to rescue those that suffer in the cold.

attacks.name: Volcanic Heat
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Salandit
data.flavorText: Its venom sacs produce a fluid that this Pokémon then heats up with the flame in its tail. This process creates Salandit's poisonous gas.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Wailmer
data.flavorText: It shows off by spraying jets of seawater from the nostrils above its eyes. It eats a solid ton of Wishiwashi every day.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: This Pokémon generates electricity by contracting its muscles. Excited trembling is a sign that Shinx is generating a tremendous amount of electricity.

attacks.name: Thunder Jolt
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Emolga
data.flavorText: As it flies, it scatters electricity around, so bird Pokémon keep their distance. That's why Emolga can keep all its food to itself.

attacks.name: Thunder Shock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Gloom
data.flavorText: Its pistils exude an incredibly foul odor. The horrid stench can cause fainting at a distance of 1.25 miles.

attacks.name: Offensive Scent
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused and Poisoned.

data.name: Yanma
data.flavorText: If it flaps its wings really fast, it can generate shock waves that will shatter windows in the area.

attacks.name: Swoop Across
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Yanmega
data.flavorText: This six-legged Pokémon is easily capable of transporting an adult in flight. The wings on its tail help it stay balanced.

attacks.name: Shoot Through
attacks.text: This attack also does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Jet Wing
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Radiant Charizard
data.flavorText: It spits fire that is hot enough to melt boulders. It may cause forest fires by blowing flames.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

abilities.name: Excited Heart
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks cost Colorless less for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

attacks.name: Combustion Blast
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't use Combustion Blast.

data.name: Simisear VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Fireball Fever
attacks.text: You may discard up to 5 cards from the top of your deck. This attack does 40 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

attacks.name: Ember Star
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage for each Energy card in your discard pile. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Seel
data.flavorText: Thanks to its thick fat, cold seas don't bother it at all, but it gets tired pretty easily in warm waters.

data.name: Galarian Mr. Mime
data.flavorText: It can radiate chilliness from the bottoms of its feet. It'll spend the whole day tap-dancing on a frozen floor.

attacks.name: Find It
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Item card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Snorunt
data.flavorText: It can only survive in cold areas. It bounces happily around, even in environments as cold as -150 degrees Fahrenheit.

data.name: Luvdisc
data.flavorText: Luvdisc makes its home in coral reefs in warm seas. It especially likes sleeping in the space between Corsola's branches.

attacks.name: Emotional Draw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 5 cards.

data.name: Kyogre
data.flavorText: It is said to have widened the seas by causing downpours. It had been asleep in a marine trench.

attacks.name: Wave Summoning
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Dynamic Wave
attacks.text: Put 3 Energy attached to this Pokémon into your hand. This attack does 180 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Glaceon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frost Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Water Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Shinx
data.flavorText: All of its fur dazzles if danger is sensed. It flees while the foe is momentarily blinded.

data.name: Luxray
data.flavorText: Luxray can see through solid objects. It will instantly spot prey trying to hide behind walls, even if the walls are thick.

abilities.name: Explosiveness
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is in your hand when you are setting up to play, you may put it face down as your Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Seeking Fang
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Trainer cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.

data.name: Helioptile
data.flavorText: When spread, the frills on its head act like solar panels, generating the power behind this Pokémon's electric moves.

data.name: Heliolisk
data.flavorText: A now-vanished desert culture treasured these Pokémon. Appropriately, when Heliolisk came to the Galar region, treasure came with them.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 50 damage to itself.

data.name: Radiant Charjabug
data.flavorText: While its durable shell protects it from attacks, Charjabug strikes at enemies with jolts of electricity discharged from the tips of its jaws.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

abilities.name: Shocking Block
abilities.text: Whenever any player attaches an Energy card from their hand to 1 of their Pokémon V, put 2 damage counters on that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Linear Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

data.name: Zeraora
data.flavorText: It approaches its enemies at the speed of lightning, then tears them limb from limb with its sharp claws.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 20 damage to itself.

data.name: Exeggcute
data.flavorText: Though it may look like it's just a bunch of eggs, it's a proper Pokémon. Exeggcute communicates with others of its kind via telepathy, apparently.

attacks.name: Psy Bolt
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

data.name: Girafarig
data.flavorText: Its tail has a small brain of its own. Beware! If you get close, it may react to your scent by biting.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Hatterene VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Witch's Domain
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may move up to 2 damage counters from your Pokémon to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: G-Max Smite
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Liepard
data.flavorText: Don't be fooled by its gorgeous fur and elegant figure. This is a moody and vicious Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 40 damage for each heads.

data.name: Zacian VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Break Edge
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Sword Star
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Radiant Eternatus
data.flavorText: The core on its chest absorbs energy emanating from the lands of the Galar region. This energy is what allows Eternatus to stay active.
rules: Radiant Pokémon Rule: You can't have more than 1 Radiant Pokémon in your deck.

abilities.name: Climactic Gate
abilities.text: When you play this Pokémon from your hand onto your Bench during your turn, you may search your deck for up to 2 Pokémon VMAX and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

data.name: Eevee V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Vee Brave
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon V, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Snorlax
data.flavorText: This Pokémon's stomach is so strong, even eating moldy or rotten food will not affect it.

data.name: Starly
data.flavorText: They flock around mountains and fields, chasing after bug Pokémon. Their singing is noisy and annoying.

attacks.name: Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Regigigas VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Star Guardian
abilities.text: During your turn, if your opponent has exactly 1 Prize card remaining, you may choose 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. They discard that Pokémon and all attached cards. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Zeraora VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Crushing Beat
attacks.text: You may discard a Stadium in play.

attacks.name: Lightning Storm Star
attacks.text: Choose 1 of your opponent's Pokémon 4 times. (You can choose the same Pokémon more than once.) For each time you chose a Pokémon, do 60 damage to it. This damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Gumshoos
data.flavorText: Patient by nature, this Pokémon loses control of itself and pounces when it spots its favorite meal—Rattata!

attacks.name: Stakeout Headbutt
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon moved from the Bench to the Active Spot during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Pincurchin
data.flavorText: It feeds on seaweed, using its teeth to scrape it off rocks. Electric current flows from the tips of its spines.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Continuous Tumble
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Bede
rules: Attach a basic Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Tapu Lele
data.flavorText: Although called a guardian deity, Tapu Lele is devoid of guilt about its cruel disposition and can be described as nature incarnate.

attacks.name: Energy Burst
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to both Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Spiral Drain
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from this Pokémon.

data.name: Friends in Hisui
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Hatterene V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Horoscope
attacks.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. You may attach any number of Energy cards you find there to this Pokémon. Put the other cards back in any order.

attacks.name: Teleportation Burst
attacks.text: Switch this Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

data.name: Nessa
rules: Put up to 4 in any combination of Water Pokémon and Water Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Solrock
data.flavorText: When it rotates itself, it gives off light similar to the sun, thus blinding its foes.

abilities.name: Sun Energy
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may attach a Psychic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Lunatone.

data.name: Poké Ball
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Riolu
data.flavorText: It's exceedingly energetic, with enough stamina to keep running all through the night. Taking it for walks can be a challenging experience.

data.name: Switch
rules: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Purrloin
data.flavorText: It steals things from people just to amuse itself with their frustration. A rivalry exists between this Pokémon and Nickit.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 10 damage for each heads.

data.name: Ultra Ball
rules: You can use this card only if you discard 2 other cards from your hand. Search your deck for a Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Dragalge
data.flavorText: Dragalge uses a poisonous liquid capable of corroding metal to send tankers that enter its territory to the bottom of the sea.

attacks.name: Rocket Poison
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. If this Pokémon evolved from Skrelp during this turn, put 8 damage counters on that Pokémon instead of 1 during Pokémon Checkup.

data.name: Friends in Sinnoh
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Galarian Meowth
data.flavorText: Living with a savage, seafaring people has toughened this Pokémon's body so much that parts of it have turned to iron.

attacks.name: Fasten Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

data.name: Volo
rules: Discard 1 of your Benched Pokémon V and all attached cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.

data.name: Zacian
data.flavorText: Now armed with a weapon it used in ancient times, this Pokémon needs only a single strike to fell even Gigantamax Pokémon.

attacks.name: Battle Legion
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Zacian V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Piercing Strike
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness or Resistance, or by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Behemoth Blade
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Pokémon VMAX, this attack does 160 more damage.

data.name: Zamazenta
data.flavorText: Its ability to deflect any attack led to it being known as the Fighting Master's Shield. It was feared and respected by all.

abilities.name: Metal Shield
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Energy attached, it takes 30 less damage from attacks (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn, this attack does 120 more damage.

data.name: Rayquaza VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Azure Pulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Max Burst
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of basic Fire Energy or any amount of basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Tauros
data.flavorText: When Tauros begins whipping itself with its tails, it's a warning that the Pokémon is about to charge with astounding speed.

attacks.name: Adrena-Tackle
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has no damage counters on it, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Shaymin
data.flavorText: The blooming of Gracidea flowers confers the power of flight upon it. Feelings of gratitude are the message it delivers.

attacks.name: Gather Flowers
attacks.text: Shuffle up to 2 Energy cards from your discard pile into your deck.

data.name: Greedent V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Body Slam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Nom-Nom-Nom Incisors
attacks.text: Draw 3 cards.

data.name: Dubwool
data.flavorText: Weave a carpet from its springy wool, and you end up with something closer to a trampoline. You'll start to bounce the moment you set foot on it.

attacks.name: Overhead Throw
attacks.text: This attack also does 10 damage to 1 of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Rolling Dash
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Energy Retrieval
rules: Put up to 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Energy Search
rules: Search your deck for a basic Energy card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Energy Switch
rules: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Great Ball
rules: Look at the top 7 cards of your deck. You may reveal a Pokémon you find there and put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Hop
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Pokémon Catcher
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Elesa's Sparkle
rules: Choose up to 2 of your Fusion Strike Pokémon. For each of those Pokémon, search your deck for a Fusion Strike Energy card and attach it to that Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Professor's Research
data.flavorText: Professor Rowan
rules: Discard your hand and draw 7 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Zeraora V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Thunderous Bolt
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Zeraora VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Reactive Pulse
attacks.text: This attack does 60 damage for each of your opponent's Pokémon in play that has an Ability.

attacks.name: Max Fist
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy from this Pokémon.

data.name: Mew V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Energy Mix
attacks.text: Search your deck for an Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Fusion Strike Pokémon. Then, shuffle your deck.

attacks.name: Psychic Leap
attacks.text: You may shuffle this Pokémon and all attached cards into your deck.

data.name: Dusclops
data.flavorText: Its body is entirely hollow. When it opens its mouth, it sucks everything in as if it were a black hole.

attacks.name: Fade to Black
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Absol
data.flavorText: Swift as the wind, Absol races through fields and mountains. Its curved, bow-like horn is acutely sensitive to the warning signs of natural disasters.

attacks.name: Lost Claw
attacks.text: Put a random card from your opponent's hand in the Lost Zone.

data.name: Krokorok
data.flavorText: It buries some of its prey in the sand to use as emergency meals when its hunts are unsuccessful.

attacks.name: Dredge Up
attacks.text: Discard the top 3 cards of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Pangoro
data.flavorText: This Pokémon is quick to anger, and it has no problem using its prodigious strength to get its way. It lives for duels against Obstagoon.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Skrelp
data.flavorText: It drifts in the ocean, blending in with floating seaweed. When other Pokémon come to feast on the seaweed, Skrelp feasts on them instead.

data.name: Galarian Perrserker
data.flavorText: What appears to be an iron helmet is actually hardened hair. This Pokémon lives for the thrill of battle.

attacks.name: Sharp Claws
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 60 more damage.

data.name: Aron
data.flavorText: It eats iron ore—and sometimes railroad tracks— to build up the steel armor that protects its body.

attacks.name: Slight Intrusion
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Aggron
data.flavorText: Aggron has a horn sharp enough to perforate thick iron sheets. It brings down its opponents by ramming into them horn first.

attacks.name: Counter Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, if this Pokémon is damaged by an attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon equal to the damage done to this Pokémon.

data.name: Metang
data.flavorText: Two Beldum have become stuck together via their own magnetic forces. With two brains, the resulting Metang has doubled psychic powers.

attacks.name: Bullet Punch
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

data.name: Bisharp
data.flavorText: It's accompanied by a large retinue of Pawniard. Bisharp keeps a keen eye on its minions, ensuring none of them even think of double-crossing it.

attacks.name: Spike Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

data.name: Rayquaza VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Azure Pulse
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Max Burst
attacks.text: You may discard any amount of basic Fire Energy or any amount of basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Ditto
data.flavorText: It can reconstitute its entire cellular structure to change into what it sees, but it returns to normal when it relaxes.

abilities.name: Sudden Transformation
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Basic Pokémon in your discard pile, except for Pokémon with a Rule Box (Pokémon V, Pokémon-GX, etc. have Rule Boxes). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

data.name: Bidoof
data.flavorText: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

abilities.name: Carefree Countenance
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is on your Bench, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks (both yours and your opponent's).

attacks.name: Hyper Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

data.name: Chatot
data.flavorText: It can learn and speak human words. If they gather, they all learn the same saying.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 2 cards.

data.name: Regigigas V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Angry Whack
attacks.text: This attack does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Confused.

data.name: Stoutland V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Double Dip Fangs
attacks.text: If your opponent's Basic Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from this attack, take 1 more Prize card.

attacks.name: Wild Tackle
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.

data.name: Yungoos
data.flavorText: Although it will eat anything, it prefers fresh living things, so it marches down streets in search of prey.

data.name: Oranguru
data.flavorText: With waves of its fan—made from leaves and its own fur—Oranguru skillfully gives instructions to other Pokémon.

attacks.name: Primate Acting
attacks.text: Choose a Supporter card from your opponent's discard pile and use the effect of that card as the effect of this attack.

data.name: Wooloo
data.flavorText: Its curly fleece is such an effective cushion that this Pokémon could fall off a cliff and stand right back up at the bottom, unharmed.

attacks.name: Rolling Rollout
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage for each heads.

data.name: Bea
rules: Discard the top 5 cards of your deck, and attach any Energy cards you discarded in this way to your Benched Fighting Pokémon in any way you like.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Crushing Hammer
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy from 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Digging Duo
rules: Flip a coin. If heads, look at the bottom 8 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. If tails, look at the bottom 3 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Leon
rules: During this turn, your Pokémon's attacks do 30 more damage to your opponent's Active Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Rare Candy
rules: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card onto the Basic Pokémon to evolve it, skipping the Stage 1. You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Exeggutor
data.flavorText: Each of Exeggutor's three heads is thinking different thoughts. The three don't seem to be very interested in one another.

attacks.name: Powerful Storm
attacks.text: This attack does 20 damage for each Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

data.name: Mewtwo
data.flavorText: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psypump
attacks.text: Attach up to 2 Psychic Energy cards from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Limit Break
attacks.text: If your opponent has 3 or fewer Prize cards remaining, this attack does 90 more damage.

data.name: Lunatone
data.flavorText: The phase of the moon apparently has some effect on its power. It's active on the night of a full moon.

attacks.name: Cycle Draw
attacks.text: Discard a card from your hand. If you do, draw 3 cards.

attacks.name: Moon Kinesis
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

data.name: Enamorus
data.flavorText: When it flies to this land from across the sea, the bitter winter comes to an end. According to legend, this Pokémon's love gives rise to the budding of fresh life across Hisui.

attacks.name: Draining Kiss
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Loving Sympathy
attacks.text: If you have the same number of cards in your hand as your opponent, this attack does 70 more damage.

data.name: Graveler
data.flavorText: It travels by rolling down cliffs. If it falls into a river, it will explode with its last gasp.

data.name: Baltoy
data.flavorText: It was discovered in ancient ruins. While moving, it constantly spins. It stands on one foot even when asleep.

data.name: Pancham
data.flavorText: It chooses a Pangoro as its master and then imitates its master's actions. This is how it learns to battle and hunt for prey.

data.name: Rockruff
data.flavorText: This Pokémon can bond very strongly with its Trainer, but it also has a habit of biting. Raising a Rockruff for a long time can be challenging.

attacks.name: Invite Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with their Active Pokémon.

data.name: Lycanroc
data.flavorText: This form of Lycanroc is reckless. It charges headlong at its opponents, attacking without any care about what injuries it might receive.

attacks.name: Midnight Fang
attacks.text: This attack does 80 less damage for each Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Koffing
data.flavorText: It adores polluted air. Some claim that Koffing used to be more plentiful in the Galar region than they are now.

attacks.name: Smog
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned.

data.name: Hoopa
data.flavorText: It gathers things it likes and passes them through its loop to teleport them to a secret place.

attacks.name: Assault Gate
attacks.text: If this Pokémon didn't move from the Bench to the Active Spot this turn, this attack does nothing. This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness.

data.name: Scizor
data.flavorText: Bulky pincers account for one third of Scizor's body weight. A single swing of one of these pincers will crush a boulder completely.

attacks.name: X-Scissor
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Dangerous Claws
attacks.text: If your opponent's Active Pokémon is a Basic Pokémon, this attack does 80 more damage.

data.name: Lairon
data.flavorText: Lairon live in mountains brimming with spring water and iron ore, so these Pokémon often came into conflict with humans in the past.

attacks.name: Wreak Havoc
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. For each heads, discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

data.name: Pawniard
data.flavorText: It uses river stones to maintain the cutting edges of the blades covering its body. These sharpened blades allow it to bring down opponents.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 10 damage to itself.

data.name: Zamazenta V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Regal Stance
abilities.text: Once during your turn, you may discard your hand and draw 5 cards. If you use this Ability, your turn ends.

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: This attack does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

data.name: Zamazenta VSTAR
rules: VSTAR rule: When your Pokémon VSTAR is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Shield Star
abilities.text: During your turn, you may use this Ability. During your opponent's next turn, all of your Pokémon take 100 less damage from attacks from your opponent's Pokémon (after applying Weakness and Resistance). (This includes Pokémon that come into play during this turn or during your opponent's next turn.) (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

attacks.name: Giga Impact
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon can't attack.

data.name: Rayquaza V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Spiral Burst
attacks.text: You may discard up to 2 basic Fire Energy or up to 2 basic Lightning Energy from this Pokémon. This attack does 80 more damage for each card you discarded in this way.

data.name: Duraludon V
rules: V rule: When your Pokémon V is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Breaking Swipe
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, the Defending Pokémon's attacks do 30 less damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

data.name: Duraludon VMAX
rules: VMAX rule: When your Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out, your opponent takes 3 Prize cards.

abilities.name: Skyscraper
abilities.text: Prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks from your opponent's Pokémon that have Special Energy attached.

attacks.name: G-Max Pulverization
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

data.name: Friends in Sinnoh
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Lost Vacuum
rules: You can use this card only if you put another card from your hand in the Lost Zone. Choose a Pokémon Tool attached to any Pokémon, or any Stadium in play, and put it in the Lost Zone.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Potion
rules: Heal 30 damage from 1 of your Pokémon.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Raihan
rules: You can play this card only if any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn. Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to 1 of your Pokémon. If you do, search your deck for a card and put it into your hand. Then, shuffle your deck.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Rescue Carrier
rules: Put up to 2 Pokémon, each with 90 HP or less, from your discard pile into your hand.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Sky Seal Stone
rules: The Pokémon V this card is attached to can use the VSTAR Power on this card.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.
Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached.

abilities.name: Star Order
abilities.text: During your turn, you may use this Ability. During this turn, if your opponent's Active Pokémon VSTAR or Active Pokémon VMAX is Knocked Out by damage from an attack from your Basic Pokémon V, take 1 more Prize card. (You can't use more than 1 VSTAR Power in a game.)

data.name: Trekking Shoes
rules: Look at the top card of your deck. You may put that card into your hand. If you don't, discard that card and draw a card.
You may play any number of Item cards during your turn.

data.name: Friends in Hisui
rules: Draw 3 cards.
You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn.

data.name: Pikachu
data.flavorText: Pikachu that can generate powerful electricity have cheek sacs that are extra soft and super stretchy.

attacks.name: Wild Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon also does 30 damage to itself.
